Speaker: Ushiromiya Kinzo
Umineko Project (UP): "...........................Now then. How will the game be resolved this time? ...You may submit, and you may resist. ......Either way, it will truly be an entertaining banquet worth betting my short remaining life on."
Steam (ST): "............Well then, how will this game be resolved? ...You may submit, or you may resist. ...Either way, it will truly be an entertaining banquet worth betting my short remaining life on."
Original Witch Hunt (OG): ".....................Well then. How will this game be resolved? ...You may submit, and you may resist. ......Either way, it will truly be an entertaining banquet worth betting my short remaining life on."
PC Japanese (JP): 「………………………さて。この度のゲームはどう転ぶのか。…委ねるもよし、抗うもよし。……いずれにせよ、わしに残されたわずかの命を賭すに値する、実に楽しい宴よ。」
PS3 Japanese - Censored (JPC): 「………………………さて。この度のゲームはどう転ぶのか。…委ねるもよし、抗うもよし。……いずれにせよ、わしに残されたわずかの命を賭すに値する、実に楽しい宴よ」
Russian (RU): ".....................Итак. Какой же исход будет у этой игры? ...Ты можешь сдаться, а можешь и сопротивляться. ......В любом случае, это будет воистину занимательный пир, достойный того, чтобы поставить на него отмеренный мне недолгий срок."
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): "...........................Pois bem... Como o jogo será resolvido desta vez? ...Você deve se submeter ou deve resistir? ......De ambas as formas, será um divertido banquete digno de se apostar o que resta da minha curta vida."
Chinese Traditional (CHT): 「………………………哼哼。本次的遊戲會如何展開呢？…委身也好，抵抗也罷。……不管怎樣，這都會是值得賭上我所剩無幾的性命的，實在愉快的宴會。」
Chinese Simplified (CN): 「………………………哼哼。本次的游戏会如何展开呢？…委身也好，抵抗也罢。……不管怎样，这都会是值得赌上我所剩无几的性命的，实在愉快的宴会。」

Umineko Project (UP): In his dimly lit study, which was occasionally brightened by lightning, Kinzo kept mumbling to himself, laughing to himself.
Steam (ST): In his dimly lit study, occasionally brightened by lightning, Kinzo kept mumbling and laughing to himself.
Original Witch Hunt (OG): In his dimly lit study, which was occasionally brightened by lightning, Kinzo kept mumbling to himself, laughed by himself.
PC Japanese (JP): 金蔵は薄暗い書斎で、時折、稲光に照らされながら、ぶつぶつと独り言を口走っては、それにひとり、笑う。
Russian (RU): Находясь в своем тускло освещённом кабинете, изредка озаряемом вспышкой молнии, Кинзо, посмеиваясь, что‐то бормотал про себя.
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): Em seu estúdio pouco iluminado, que ocasionalmente clareava devido aos raios, Kinzo continuava a murmurar para si mesmo, rindo sozinho.
Chinese Traditional (CHT): 在陰暗的書房中，隨著一陣陣閃電照亮臉龐，金藏嘰哩咕嚕地自言自語完後，獨自一笑。
Chinese Simplified (CN): 在阴暗的书房中，随着一阵阵闪电照亮脸庞，金藏叽哩咕噜地自言自语完后，独自一笑。

Umineko Project (UP): On the antique clock with an intricate design that was sitting on his desk, the two overlapping hands had begun to tilt to the right, and separate from one another.
Steam (ST): On the antique clock with the intricate design that had been sitting on his desk, the two overlapping hands tilted to the right and began to slide.
Original Witch Hunt (OG): On the antique clock with the intricate design that had been sitting on his desk, the two overlapping hands tilted to the right, and began to slide.
PC Japanese (JP): 机の上に置かれた、凝った意匠の施されたアンティークの時計は、重なっていた２本の針を右に傾かせ、ずらし始めている。
Russian (RU): На антикварных часах причудливого облика, стоявших у него на столе, две совпавшие стрелки сдвинулись вправо и принялись скользить вниз.
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): O clássico relógio com um intrigante design estava sobre sua mesma, os dois ponteiros sobrepostos começaram a se inclinar para a direita, separando‐se um do outro.
Chinese Traditional (CHT): 擺在桌上的造工精細的古董時鐘中，兩根重合在一起的指針已開始往右傾斜，慢慢錯開。
Chinese Simplified (CN): 摆在桌上的造工精细的古董时钟中，两根重合在一起的指针已开始往右倾斜，慢慢错开。

Umineko Project (UP): The passage of time that had counted to 24 had returned to 0, and begun to start counting again...
Steam (ST): The measure of time that counted up to 24...had returned to 0...and had begun to count back again...
Original Witch Hunt (OG): The measure of time that counted to 24 had returned to 0, and had begun to count back again...
PC Japanese (JP): ２４を数えた時の刻みが０に戻り、再びそれを数え直していた…。
Russian (RU): Измеряемое время достигло 24 и вернулось к 0, а затем начался обратный отсчёт...
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): A passagem do tempo havia contado até 24 e retornado ao 0, começando mais uma vez sua contagem...
Chinese Traditional (CHT): 數到了二十四的時刻回到了零，再次重新數了起來…。
Chinese Simplified (CN): 数到了二十四的时刻回到了零，再次重新数了起来…。

Speaker: Ushiromiya Kinzo
Umineko Project (UP): "......The passage of time is a brutal thing. It drags itself all the way to 24 over the course of a day, and then returns back to 0. ......It surely managed to count to 23:59. However, was it ever able to reach 24:00? ......If you believe that it returns to 0:00 again without reaching it, how futile it seems."
Steam (ST): "...Measuring time is a brutal thing. It drags itself all the way to 24 over the course of a day, and then returns back to 0. ...It certainly did count to 23:59. However, is it ever able to reach 24:00? ...If you conclude that it returns to 0:00 again without reaching 24, how futile it must all be."
Original Witch Hunt (OG): "......Measuring time is a brutal thing. It drags itself all the way to 24 over the course of a day, and then returns back to 0. ......It surely counts to 23:59. However, is it ever able to reach 24:00? ......If you believe that it returns to 0:00 again without reaching it, how futile it seems."
PC Japanese (JP): 「……時の刻みとは残酷なものよ。２４を数えるために一日を掛けて辿り着き、そして再び０に戻る。……２３時５９分までは確かに数えただろう。しかし、２４時に辿り着くことはできたのだろうか？　……辿り着けず、再び０時に戻ったと考えれば、それは何とも虚しいことよ。」
PS3 Japanese - Censored (JPC): 「……時の刻みとは残酷なものよ。２４を数えるために一日を掛けて辿り着き、そして再び０に戻る。……２３時５９分までは確かに数えただろう。しかし、２４時に辿り着くことはできたのだろうか？　……辿り着けず、再び０時に戻ったと考えれば、それは何とも虚しいことよ」
Russian (RU): "......Измеряемое время жестоко. Оно тащится до 24 в течение дня, а затем возвращается обратно к нулю. ......Оно вне всякого сомнения достигает 23:59. Вот только сможет ли оно когда‐нибудь достичь 24:00? ......Если верить, что оно вновь возвращается к 0:00, то каким же напрасным кажется это течение."
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): "......A passagem do tempo é algo brutal. Ela se arrasta por um longo caminho até bater 24 durante o curso do dia, e então, mais uma vez retorna ao 0. ......Certamente é possível contar até 23:59. Entretanto, nunca foi capaz de chegar 24:00? ......Se você acredita que ele retorna às 0:00 novamente sem alcançá‐lo, o quão fútil isso parece ser?"
Chinese Traditional (CHT): 「……所謂時刻可真是殘酷。為了數到二十四，費盡一日抵達此處，然後再度回到了零。……直至二十三點五十九分，是確實能數到的。只不過，這到底有沒有抵達二十四點呢？……如果按未能抵達，再度回到了零來想，這是何等的徒勞呢。」
Chinese Simplified (CN): 「……所谓时刻可真是残酷。为了数到二十四，费尽一日抵达此处，然后再度回到了零。……直至二十三点五十九分，是确实能数到的。只不过，这到底有没有抵达二十四点呢？……如果按未能抵达，再度回到了零来想，这是何等的徒劳呢。」

Umineko Project (UP): No, is that not the same as a person's life? You live, aiming for a perfect 24, and in the instant you reach it, you return to 0.
Steam (ST): But perhaps a person's life is the same. You live, aiming for a perfect 24, and in the instant you reach it, you return to 0.
Original Witch Hunt (OG): No, is that the same as a person's life? You live, aiming for a perfect 24, and in the instant you reach it, you return to 0.
PC Japanese (JP): いや、それこそが人の生涯か。完全な２４を目指して生き、そこに辿り着いた刹那、０に戻る。
Russian (RU): Нет, не схоже ли это с человеческой жизнью? Ты живёшь, стремясь к идеальным 24, но стоит лишь их достигнуть, как возвращаешься к 0.
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): Não, não é o mesmo que a vida de uma pessoa? Você vive, almejando por um 24 perfeito e, no instante que o alcança, você retorna ao 0.
Chinese Traditional (CHT): 唉，這即是人的一生麼。以完整的二十四為目的活著，在抵達此處的那一剎那，回歸為零。
Chinese Simplified (CN): 唉，这即是人的一生么。以完整的二十四为目的活着，在抵达此处的那一刹那，回归为零。

Umineko Project (UP): People may praise the departed, saying that they did reach 24, but that is absolutely not 24.
Steam (ST): People will probably praise the departed, saying that he did reach 24, but he most certainly did not.
Original Witch Hunt (OG): People will probably praise the departed, saying that he did reach 24, but that surely is not 24.
PC Japanese (JP): 故人は２４に辿り着けたと人々は讃えるだろうが、それは断じて２４ではない。
Russian (RU): Люди наверняка похвалят почившего, говоря, что ему удалось достичь 24, но это определённо не 24.
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): As pessoas podem louvar os que já partiram, dizendo que eles alcançaram o 24, mas isto absolutamente não é 24.
Chinese Traditional (CHT): 雖然人們讚美故人，稱他們抵達了二十四，但這絕非二十四。
Chinese Simplified (CN): 虽然人们赞美故人，称他们抵达了二十四，但这绝非二十四。

Umineko Project (UP): .........It is nothing more than 0.
Steam (ST): ......In the end, he's a 0.
Original Witch Hunt (OG): .........After all, that is 0.
PC Japanese (JP): ………所詮は、０なのだ。
Russian (RU): .........А всё‐таки 0.
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): .........Não é meramente mais do que 0.
Chinese Traditional (CHT): ………終歸只是，一個零。
Chinese Simplified (CN): ………终归只是，一个零。

Speaker: Ushiromiya Kinzo
Umineko Project (UP): "I am different. ......I will reach 24 alive. Because that itself is the Golden Land. ...That is {f:5:Beatrice}'s dwelling."
Steam (ST): "I am different. ...I will live and reach 24. That itself is the Golden Land. ...For that is where {f:5:Beatrice} dwells."
Original Witch Hunt (OG): "I am different. ......I will live and reach 24. That itself is the Golden Land. ...Because that is Beatrice's dwelling."
PC Japanese (JP): 「わしは違うぞ。……わしは生きて２４に辿り着く。そここそが黄金郷。…ベアトリーチェの住処なのだから。」
PS3 Japanese - Censored (JPC): 「わしは違うぞ。……わしは生きて２４に辿り着く。そここそが黄金郷。…ベアトリーチェの住処なのだから」
Russian (RU): "Но я отличаюсь от других. ......Я выживу и достигну 24. Это, в сущности, и есть Золотая Земля. ...Потому что там обитает {f:5:Беатриче}."
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): "Eu sou diferente. ......Eu chegarei ao 24 vivo. Porque isto em si é a Terra Dourada. ...É onde a {f:5:Beatrice} reside."
Chinese Traditional (CHT): 「我可不同。……我會活著抵達二十四。因為，那即正是黃金鄉。…是貝阿朵莉切的住處。」
Chinese Simplified (CN): 「我可不同。……我会活着抵达二十四。因为，那即正是黄金乡。…是贝阿朵莉切的住处。」

Umineko Project (UP): Kinzo had been fumbling around with some tarot cards for some time.
Steam (ST): Kinzo had been fumbling around with some tarot cards for some time.
Original Witch Hunt (OG): [=UP]
PC Japanese (JP): 金蔵は先ほどからずっと、タロットカードを弄っていた。
Russian (RU): Какое‐то время Кинзо перебирал карты таро.
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): Kinzo estava se entretendo com cartas de tarot por um tempo.
Chinese Traditional (CHT): 從剛才起，金藏就一直在撥弄著塔羅牌。
Chinese Simplified (CN): 从刚才起，金藏就一直在拨弄着塔罗牌。

Umineko Project (UP): It looked as though he was trying to divine his own luck, his own propensity for victory, and doing it over every time he didn't like the result.
Steam (ST): It looked as though he was trying to divine his own luck with a contest, doing it over every time he didn't like the result.
Original Witch Hunt (OG): It looked as though he was trying to divine his own luck in the contest, and doing it over every time he didn't like the result.
PC Japanese (JP): そして己の勝負運を占っては、その結果が気に入らない度にやり直しているように見えた。
Russian (RU): Казалось, словно он пытается предсказать собственную удачу в состязании, и получавшийся каждый раз расклад не радовал его.
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): Parecia que ele estava tentando adivinhar sua própria sorte, sua própria propensão para vitória, fazendo isto novamente cada vez que ele não obtinha um resultado que o agradasse.
Chinese Traditional (CHT): 看起來是對自己勝負運的占卜結果不滿意，一遍又一遍地重來。
Chinese Simplified (CN): 看起来是对自己胜负运的占卜结果不满意，一遍又一遍地重来。

Umineko Project (UP): The most forbidden action in tarot reading is to try predicting the same thing twice.
Steam (ST): The most forbidden action in tarot reading is trying to predict the same thing twice.
Original Witch Hunt (OG): The most forbidden action in tarot reading was to try predicting the same thing twice.
PC Japanese (JP): タロット占いでもっとも禁じられている行為は、同じことを二度占うことである。
Russian (RU): Самым запретным поступком при чтении карт таро было дважды пытаться предсказать одну и ту же вещь.
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): O ato de maior proibição na leitura do tarot é tentar prever a mesma coisa duas vezes.
Chinese Traditional (CHT): 塔羅牌占卜最忌諱的行為，就是重複占卜同一件事。
Chinese Simplified (CN): 塔罗牌占卜最忌讳的行为，就是重复占卜同一件事。

Umineko Project (UP): It is a desecration to the result of the fortune telling, and also desecrates the existence higher than humans which delivers signs through the tarot cards.
Steam (ST): To do so ridicules the results of fortune telling... and also desecrates those beings higher than humans that give revelations through the tarot cards.
Original Witch Hunt (OG): That was a desecration to the result of the fortune telling, and also desecrated the existence higher than humans which became an oracle through the tarot cards.
PC Japanese (JP): それは占いの結果に対する冒涜であり、タロットを通じて神託を与えてくれる、人より上位の存在への冒涜ともなるのである。
Russian (RU): Такой поступок осквернял результат ворожбы, включая также стоящую над людьми сущность, становившуюся оракулом через карты таро.
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): É uma profanação ao resultado da leitura da sorte, e também profana a existência superior aos humanos que entrega sinais através das cartas de tarot.
Chinese Traditional (CHT): 這既是對占卜結果的冒瀆，還會被視為，對通過塔羅牌給予神旨的，位居人類之上的存在的褻瀆。
Chinese Simplified (CN): 这既是对占卜结果的冒渎，还会被视为，对通过塔罗牌给予神旨的，位居人类之上的存在的亵渎。

Umineko Project (UP): However, Kinzo knew.
Steam (ST): However, Kinzo knew.
Original Witch Hunt (OG): However, Kinzo knew.
PC Japanese (JP): しかし、金蔵は知っている。
Russian (RU): Но Кинзо знал причину.
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): Entretanto, Kinzo sabia.
Chinese Traditional (CHT): 然而，金藏是知道的。
Chinese Simplified (CN): [=CHT]

Umineko Project (UP): The reason the tarot cards shouldn't be used twice was that, since it was nothing more than a random number generator, it was natural that if you read them twice, a different result would appear.
Steam (ST): Tarot cards shouldn't be used twice because...since they're nothing more than a random number generator, reading them twice will naturally cause a different result to appear.
Original Witch Hunt (OG): The reason the tarot cards shouldn't be used twice was that, since it was nothing more than a random number generator, it was natural that if you read them twice, a different result could appear.
PC Japanese (JP): タロットが二度占ってはならないのは、これが単なる乱数発生器でしかないため、二度占えば異なる結果が出るのは当然だからだ。
Russian (RU): Карты таро не полагалось использовать дважды, поскольку они были не более чем генератором случайных чисел, а значит естественно, что при втором чтении получится другой результат.
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): O motivo pelo qual cartas de tarot não deveriam ser usadas duas vezes, já era nada mais do que um gerador de números aleatórios, era natural que se você as lê‐se uma segunda vez, um resultado diferente iria aparecer.
Chinese Traditional (CHT): 塔羅牌不能重複占卜，只是因為，它僅是一個亂數發生器，重複占卜出現不一樣的結果乃是理所當然之事。
Chinese Simplified (CN): 塔罗牌不能重复占卜，只是因为，它仅是一个乱数发生器，重复占卜出现不一样的结果乃是理所当然之事。

Umineko Project (UP): ......Therefore, reading twice was only forbidden to preserve the mystique of the tarot cards' results.
Steam (ST): ...Therefore, reading them twice was only forbidden to preserve the mystique of the tarot cards' results.
Original Witch Hunt (OG): [=UP]
PC Japanese (JP): ……だから、タロットの結果に神秘性を持たせるために、二度の占いを禁じているに過ぎないのだ。
Russian (RU): ......Таким образом, запрет на второе чтение был призван сохранить мистику результата от карт таро.
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): ......Portanto, ler duas vezes era proibido para preservar a mística dos resultados das cartas de tarot.
Chinese Traditional (CHT): ……所以，這僅僅是為了讓塔羅牌得出的結果具有神秘性，才禁止了重複占卜。
Chinese Simplified (CN): ……所以，这仅仅是为了让塔罗牌得出的结果具有神秘性，才禁止了重复占卜。

Umineko Project (UP): ...However, that didn't mean that Kinzo didn't take tarot reading seriously.
Steam (ST): ...However, that didn't mean that Kinzo didn't take tarot reading seriously.
Original Witch Hunt (OG): [=UP]
PC Japanese (JP): …しかし、だからといって金蔵がタロット占いを馬鹿にしているわけではない。
Russian (RU): ...Но это не означало, что Кинзо легкомысленно относился к чтению карт таро.
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): ...No entanto, isso não significava que Kinzo não levasse a leitura do tarot a sério.
Chinese Traditional (CHT): …不過，這也並不是說，金藏把塔羅牌占卜視為了兒戲。
Chinese Simplified (CN): …不过，这也并不是说，金藏把塔罗牌占卜视为了儿戏。

Umineko Project (UP): Kinzo's interpretation of tarot reading was done in a completely different way.
Steam (ST): Kinzo's interpretation of tarot reading was done in a completely different way.
Original Witch Hunt (OG): Kinzo's interpretation of tarot reading was done in a completely different way.
PC Japanese (JP): 金蔵の解釈によるタロット占いは、まったく別のやり方だった。
Russian (RU): Просто его интерпретация чтения карт таро заключалась в совершенно ином подходе.
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): A interpretação de Kinzo sobre a leitura das cartas de tarot era feita de uma forma completamente diferente.
Chinese Traditional (CHT): 根據金藏的理解，塔羅牌占卜有著完全不同的規矩。
Chinese Simplified (CN): 根据金藏的理解，塔罗牌占卜有着完全不同的规矩。

Umineko Project (UP): That was to repeat the reading, over and over, until he reached the result most favorable to him, without the slightest amount of compromise.
Steam (ST): That was to repeat the reading, over and over, without giving up in the slightest, until he reached the result most favorable to him.
Original Witch Hunt (OG): That was to repeat the reading, over and over, without giving up in the slightest, until he reached the result most favorable to him.
PC Japanese (JP): それは、自分の得たい最高の結果が出るまで、一切の妥協なく、何度も何度もタロットを繰り返すことだ。
Russian (RU): А именно — в повторении раз за разом, не сдаваясь, пока не достигался наиболее желательный результат.
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): Era necessário repetir a leitura, diversas vezes, até que ele chegasse ao resultado mais favorável para si próprio, sem a menor quantia de compromisso.
Chinese Traditional (CHT): 這即是指，在出現自己想要的最棒的結果前，不做任何妥協，一遍又一遍地反覆占卜。
Chinese Simplified (CN): 这即是指，在出现自己想要的最棒的结果前，不做任何妥协，一遍又一遍地反复占卜。

Umineko Project (UP): It would depend on how he defined the result most favorable to him, but if he demanded the best result in a strict sense, it would be the same as a simple roulette of luck, where he sought an arithmetic miracle.
Steam (ST): The mark he set for this "most favorable result" would vary, but when he demanded the most favorable result in a strictly literal sense, it was the same as a simple roulette of luck, where he seeked an arithmetic miracle.
Original Witch Hunt (OG): What the best result was depended on the definition, but if he demanded the best result in a strict sense, it was the same as a simple roulette of luck, where he seeked an arithmetic miracle.
PC Japanese (JP): 最高の結果がどの程度のものかの定義にもよるが、厳密な意味での最高の結果を求めたなら、それは単なる算数的奇跡を求める運のルーレットと同じになる。
Russian (RU): Какой результат являлся наилучшим, зависело от определения, но точный смысл наилучшего результата был схож с удачей по принципу рулетки, где он стремился обрести арифметическое чудо.
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): Depende apenas de como ele define o resultado mais favorável para si, mas se ele demandar o melhor resultado em um sentido bem estrito, seria o mesmo que uma simples roleta da sorte, onde ele busca por um milagre aritmético.
Chinese Traditional (CHT): 最棒的結果雖會視“最棒”的定義而改變，但以嚴密意義上的“謀求最棒的結果”來說，這就與單純謀求數學上的奇跡的幸運輪盤賭相同。
Chinese Simplified (CN): 最棒的结果虽会视“最棒”的定义而改变，但以严密意义上的“谋求最棒的结果”来说，这就与单纯谋求数学上的奇迹的幸运轮盘赌相同。

Umineko Project (UP): ......However, to Kinzo, who made miracles of numbers the basis of his magical power, this could become very much like a magic ritual.
Steam (ST): ...However, Kinzo used miracles of numbers as the basis of his magical power, so this functioned perfectly well as a magical ritual.
Original Witch Hunt (OG): [=UP]
PC Japanese (JP): ……しかし、数字の奇跡こそを魔力の根源とする金蔵にとって、それは充分、魔法の儀式となり得た。
Russian (RU): ......Для Кинзо, тем не менее, взявшего чудотворность чисел за основу своей магической силы, это очень даже уподобилось магическому ритуалу.
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): ......Porém, para Kinzo, que fez milagres de números com a base de seu poder mágico, isto se torna algo muito semelhante a um ritual mágico.
Chinese Traditional (CHT): ……不過，對於把數字奇跡當成了魔力根源的金藏來說，這就足以構成魔法的儀式。
Chinese Simplified (CN): ……不过，对于把数字奇迹当成了魔力根源的金藏来说，这就足以构成魔法的仪式。

Umineko Project (UP): In other words, until the result he desired appeared perfectly, he would repeat the tarot readings over and over, turning his labor, conviction, and the feelings of his heart into a prayer, so that when it reached heaven, the result would be sublimated—this was Kinzo's personal magical interpretation.
Steam (ST): In other words, until the result he desired appeared perfectly, he would strive to repeat the tarot readings over and over, with conviction, turning the feelings of his heart into prayers, so that when they reached the heavens, they would be sublimated into results. This was Kinzo's personal magical interpretation.
Original Witch Hunt (OG): In other words, until the result he desired appeared perfectly, he would strive to repeat the tarot readings over and over, with conviction, turning the feelings of his heart into a prayer, so that when it reached heaven, the result would be sublimated. This was Kinzo's personal magical interpretation.
PC Japanese (JP): つまり、自分の望む結果が完全に出るまで、延々とタロットを繰り返すその手間と信念、心の気持ちが祈祷に通じ、それが天に届いた時、結果となって昇華されるという、金蔵独自の魔法解釈だ。
Russian (RU): Другими словами, пока не возникал идеально подходящий ему результат, он повторял чтение карт таро вновь и вновь, не теряя упорства, преображая чувства своей души в молитву, чтобы когда та достигнет небес, привлекла нужный результат. Такова была личная магическая интерпретация Кинзо.
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): Em outras palavras, até que o resultado que ele deseje apareça perfeitamente, ele irá repetir a leitura incessantemente, transformando em seu trabalho, sua convicção, e os sentimentos de seu coração em preces, para que quando ele alcance os céus, o resultado seja sublimado — esta é a interpretação pessoal da magia de Kinzo.
Chinese Traditional (CHT): 換言之，所謂在自己所求的結果完美無缺地出現前，沒完沒了地重複塔羅牌占卜的這份勞力、信念、心境與祈禱相通，傳到上天之時，升華為結果，這就是金藏對魔法的個人解釋。
Chinese Simplified (CN): 换言之，所谓在自己所求的结果完美无缺地出现前，没完没了地重复塔罗牌占卜的这份劳力、信念、心境与祈祷相通，传到上天之时，升华为结果，这就是金藏对魔法的个人解释。

Umineko Project (UP): Therefore, even though the tarot cards Kinzo used were exactly the same as generally used tarot cards, the way they were used was completely different...
Steam (ST): Therefore, even though Kinzo's tarot cards were no different from those generally used, the way in which they were used was completely different...
Original Witch Hunt (OG): Therefore, even though the tarot cards Kinzo used were exactly the same as generally used tarot cards, the way they were used was completely different...
PC Japanese (JP): だから、金蔵が扱っているタロットは、世間一般のタロットとまったく同じものだったが、そのやり方がまったく異なっていたのだ…。
Russian (RU): Таким образом, он хоть и пользовался обычными и повсеместно применяемыми картами таро, способ их применения был совершенно иным...
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): Portanto, mesmo que as cartas de tarot que Kinzo usou sejam exatamente as mesmas usadas no tarot, a forma como elas são usadas é completamente diferente...
Chinese Traditional (CHT): 所以，金藏使用的塔羅牌，雖與社會上一般的塔羅牌完全相同，但它的規矩卻完全不一樣…。
Chinese Simplified (CN): 所以，金藏使用的塔罗牌，虽与社会上一般的塔罗牌完全相同，但它的规矩却完全不一样…。

Speaker: Ushiromiya Kinzo
Steam (ST): "......... ...Tonight...will not go as I thought."
Original Witch Hunt (OG): ".....................Tonight, ......will not go as I thought."
PS3 Japanese - Censored (JPC): 「……………………………。…今宵は、……思い通りにならぬな」
Russian (RU): ".....................Сегодня... не получится так, как я думал."
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): "................................. ...Esta noite, ......elas estão se recusando a jogar como eu quero."

Umineko Project (UP): Kinzo stopped his hands for a second.
Steam (ST): Kinzo stopped his hands for a second.
Original Witch Hunt (OG): [=UP]
PC Japanese (JP): 金蔵は一度手を止める。
Russian (RU): Кинзо на секунду остановил руки.
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): Kinzo parou suas mãos por um segundo.
Chinese Traditional (CHT): 金藏停了下來。
Chinese Simplified (CN): 金藏停了下来。

Umineko Project (UP): ...It seemed the result he expected wasn't showing up.
Steam (ST): ...He seemed not to be getting the results he wanted.
Original Witch Hunt (OG): [=UP]
PC Japanese (JP): …なかなか思い通りの結果が出ないようだった。
Russian (RU): ...По‐видимому, ожидаемый им результат всё никак не получался.
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): ...Parece que o resultado que ele esperava não estava vindo.
Chinese Traditional (CHT): …似乎是怎麼都占卜不出一個稱心如意的結果。
Chinese Simplified (CN): …似乎是怎么都占卜不出一个称心如意的结果。

Umineko Project (UP): On the contrary, many bad cards that shouldn't often appear were appearing repeatedly, and continuing to interfere with the miracle Kinzo wished for.
Steam (ST): On the contrary, bad cards that shouldn't show up so often appeared repeatedly... and continued to interfere with the miracle Kinzo wished for.
Original Witch Hunt (OG): On the contrary, many bad cards that shouldn't appear appeared repeatedly, and continued to interfere with the miracle Kinzo wished for.
PC Japanese (JP): それどころか、そうそう出るはずのない悪いカードが繰り返し現れ、金蔵の求める奇跡を妨害し続けていた。
Russian (RU): Наоборот, каждый раз попадалось множество плохих и нежелательных карт, продолжающих вмешиваться в желаемое Кинзо чудо.
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): Pelo contrário, muitas cartas que não deveriam aparecer estavam se repetindo,{n}e continuavam a interferir no milagre pelo qual Kinzo desejava.
Chinese Traditional (CHT): 豈止如此，還反覆冒出了平常不會輕易出現的壞牌，一刻不停地阻撓著金藏所求的奇跡。
Chinese Simplified (CN): 岂止如此，还反复冒出了平常不会轻易出现的坏牌，一刻不停地阻挠着金藏所求的奇迹。

Speaker: Ushiromiya Kinzo
Umineko Project (UP): "..................Hmph. ...Is that how it is?"
Steam (ST): ".........Hmph. ...Is that how it is?"
Original Witch Hunt (OG): "...............Hmph. ...Is that how it is?"
PC Japanese (JP): 「………………ふ。…そういうことなのか。」
Russian (RU): "...............Хмф. ...Вот значит как?"
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): "..................Hmph. ...É assim que vai ser?"
Chinese Traditional (CHT): 「………………呼。…是這麼一回事嗎？」
Chinese Simplified (CN): 「………………呼。…是这么一回事吗？」

Umineko Project (UP): It seemed that Kinzo had taken some kind of sign from this abnormal course of events.
Steam (ST): Kinzo seemed to have received some revelation that was different from normal.
Original Witch Hunt (OG): It seemed that Kinzo had received some oracle that that was different from normal.
PC Japanese (JP): 普段とは違う流れに、金蔵は何かの神託を得たらしい。
Russian (RU): Похоже, Кинзо получил предсказание, отличавшееся от обычного.
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): Parece que Kinzo assumiu isso como sendo um sinal sobre um anormal curso de eventos que estariam por vir.
Chinese Traditional (CHT): 面對與平時不同的情況，金藏似乎得到了某種神旨。
Chinese Simplified (CN): 面对与平时不同的情况，金藏似乎得到了某种神旨。

Umineko Project (UP): But judging by the unlucky cards scattered over the desk, it was difficult to imagine that the sign had been a good one...
Steam (ST): But, judging by the unlucky cards scattered across his desk, it was difficult to imagine that the omen had been a good one...
Original Witch Hunt (OG): But judging by the unlucky cards scattered over the desk, it was difficult to imagine that the oracle had been a good sign...
PC Japanese (JP): しかし、不吉なカードたちが机の上に散らばる様を見る限り、その神託が良き報せであるとは考え難かった…。
Russian (RU): Но исходя из несчастливых карт, разбросанных по столу, было трудно предположить, что предсказание несло в себе добрый знак...
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): Mas analisando as infortunas cartas espalhadas sobre sua mesa, era difícil de imaginar que aquele teria sido um bom sinal...
Chinese Traditional (CHT): 不過，從散亂在桌上的一張張不吉的卡牌來看，是難以將這神旨想像為吉兆的…。
Chinese Simplified (CN): 不过，从散乱在桌上的一张张不吉的卡牌来看，是难以将这神旨想象为吉兆的…。

Umineko Project (UP): For a while, Kinzo closed his eyes tightly, pondering something.
Steam (ST): For a while, Kinzo closed his eyes tightly, pondering something.
Original Witch Hunt (OG): For a while, Kinzo closed his eyes tightly, pondering something.
PC Japanese (JP): 金蔵はしばらくの間、固く目を閉じ、何かを思案した。
Russian (RU): Ненадолго закрыв глаза, Кинзо погрузился в размышления.
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): Por um instante, Kinzo fechou levemente seus olhos, ponderando sobre algo.
Chinese Traditional (CHT): 金藏在片刻間緊閉雙眼，思索著什麼。
Chinese Simplified (CN): 金藏在片刻间紧闭双眼，思索着什么。

Umineko Project (UP): Then as the thunder roared, he made up his mind about something, took the telephone receiver, and dialed.
Steam (ST): Then, as the thunder roared, he made up his mind about something, took the telephone receiver, and dialed.
Original Witch Hunt (OG): Then as the thunder roared, he made up his mind about something, took the telephone receiver, and dialed.
PC Japanese (JP): そして雷鳴に何かを決断し、受話器を取りダイヤルする。
Russian (RU): Затем, после того как прогремел гром, он принял какое‐то решение, снял трубку с телефона и набрал номер.
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): Um trovão rugiu, e com uma decisão em mente, ele pegou o telefone, e então discou.
Chinese Traditional (CHT): 然後，隨著雷鳴，他下了什麼決斷，拿起聽筒，撥了電話號碼。
Chinese Simplified (CN): 然后，随着雷鸣，他下了什么决断，拿起听筒，拨了电话号码。

Speaker: Ushiromiya Kinzo
Umineko Project (UP): "............It is I. Is Genji there? It is urgent."
Steam (ST): "......It is I. Is Genji there? An urgent matter has come up."
Original Witch Hunt (OG): ".........It is I. Is Genji there? It is urgent."
PC Japanese (JP): 「…………わしだ。源次はおるか。至急だ。」
PS3 Japanese - Censored (JPC): 「…………わしだ。源次はおるか。至急だ」

Brazilian Portuguese (PT): "............Sou eu. O Genji está aí? É urgente."
Chinese Traditional (CHT): 「…………是我。源次在嗎？有急事。」
Chinese Simplified (CN): 「…………是我。源次在吗？有急事。」

Speaker: Shannon
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): [=UP]
Chinese Simplified (CN): [=CHT]

Umineko Project (UP): In front of the main entrance, Shannon was cooling her flushed face in the frigid air.
Steam (ST): In front of the entrance hall, Shannon's once burning face had been cooled off by the frigid air.
Original Witch Hunt (OG): In front of the entrance hall, Shannon's previously burning face had been cooled off by the frigid air.
PC Japanese (JP): 紗音は玄関前で、冷えた空気に火照った顔を冷ましていた。
Russian (RU): Стоя перед вестибюлем, Шаннон остужала пылающее лицо прохладным дождём.
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): Em frente à entrada principal, Shannon estava resfriando seu rosto corado enquanto o ar frio batia nele.
Chinese Traditional (CHT): 紗音在大門前，用涼涼的空氣為火熱的臉龐降溫。
Chinese Simplified (CN): 纱音在大门前，用凉凉的空气为火热的脸庞降温。

Umineko Project (UP): ...She had thought......that George's proposal would surely come sometime.
Steam (ST): ...She had thought... that George's proposal would surely come sooner or later.
Original Witch Hunt (OG): ...She had thought, ......that George's proposal would surely come sometime.
PC Japanese (JP): …譲治からの求婚は、……きっといつかあるだろうと思っていた。
Russian (RU): ...Она предполагала, что предложение Джорджа должно последовать в скором времени.
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): ...Ela estava pensando......que a proposta de George certamente viria em algum momento.
Chinese Traditional (CHT): …早就想到了，……讓治的求婚總有一天一定會到來。
Chinese Simplified (CN): …早就想到了，……让治的求婚总有一天一定会到来。

Umineko Project (UP): It wasn't as if her heart had been unprepared.{n}And she had nodded as an answer.
Steam (ST): It wasn't as though she hadn't prepared herself mentally. And she had answered by nodding.
Original Witch Hunt (OG): It wasn't that her heart was not prepared. And she had nodded as if in answer.
PC Japanese (JP): 心の準備はなかったわけではない。そして、応える形で頷いてしまった。
PS3 Japanese - Censored (JPC): 心の準備はなかったわけではない。{n}そして、応える形で頷いてしまった。
Russian (RU): И не то чтобы она не подготовила своё сердце к этому.{n}И она кивнула в качестве ответа.
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): Não era como se o seu coração estivesse despreparado.{n}E sua resposta havia sido um leve balançar com a cabeça.
Chinese Traditional (CHT): 並不是沒有心理準備。{n}而且，還以點頭的形式做出了回復。
Chinese Simplified (CN): 并不是没有心理准备。{n}而且，还以点头的形式做出了回复。

Umineko Project (UP): Had she been reckless because of her youth?{n}Should she have thought about her future more seriously?
Steam (ST): Had she been reckless because of her youth? Should she have thought about her future more seriously?
Original Witch Hunt (OG): Had she been reckless because of her youth? Should she have thought about her future more seriously?
PC Japanese (JP): 若さゆえの無謀だったのだろうか？もっと将来のことは真剣に考えた方が？
PS3 Japanese - Censored (JPC): 若さゆえの無謀だったのだろうか？{n}もっと将来のことは真剣に考えた方が？
Russian (RU): Была ли она безрассудной из‐за своей молодости?{n}Стоило ли ей посерьёзней подумать о будущем?
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): Teria ela sido imprudente por causa de sua juventude?{n}Deveria ela ter pensado mais seriamente sobre o seu futuro?
Chinese Traditional (CHT): 但，這是否是出於年輕的輕率呢？{n}是不是該更認真地考慮下將來呢？
Chinese Simplified (CN): 但，这是否是出于年轻的轻率呢？{n}是不是该更认真地考虑下将来呢？

Umineko Project (UP): She found herself worrying that he might have thought of her as a cheap girl because of her immediate reply.
Steam (ST): I wonder if my immediate reply made him think I'm a cheap girl.
Original Witch Hunt (OG): I wonder if he doesn't think of me as a cheap girl because of my immediate reply.
PC Japanese (JP): 即答したせいで、むしろ安っぽい女だなんて思われはしなかったろうか。
Russian (RU): Не посчитает ли он меня дешёвой девицей из‐за моего моментального ответа.
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): Ela se encontrou preocupada que ele poderia ter pensado nela como uma garota barata por causa de sua resposta imediata.
Chinese Traditional (CHT): 會不會因為立即作出了答覆，而使他以為，自己是不值錢的女人呢？
Chinese Simplified (CN): 会不会因为立即作出了答复，而使他以为，自己是不值钱的女人呢？

Umineko Project (UP): ...Perhaps at least holding off until tomorrow morning would have given the impression of thinking more seriously?
Steam (ST): ...If I'd at least waited until tomorrow morning, would that at least have shown him I was taking this seriously?
Original Witch Hunt (OG): ...Would I have been able to look like I was thinking more seriously if I had at least held off until tomorrow morning?
PC Japanese (JP): …せめて明日の朝まで保留したほうが、真剣に考えてる雰囲気をアピールできただろうか。
Russian (RU): ...Выглядело бы со стороны, что я серьёзно думаю над этим, если бы подождала с ответом до завтрашнего утра?
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): ...Talvez se ao menos tivesse esperado até a manhã seguinte poderia passar a impressão de ter pensado mais seriamente sobre o assunto?
Chinese Traditional (CHT): …是不是應該，至少保留到明天早上再做答覆，以此表示自己在認真考慮呢？
Chinese Simplified (CN): …是不是应该，至少保留到明天早上再做答复，以此表示自己在认真考虑呢？

Umineko Project (UP): Now that she had already received the ring from George, Shannon kept fidgeting in embarrassment, thinking she should have done this, should have done that.
Steam (ST): Now that she'd already received the ring from George, Shannon kept fidgeting in embarrassment. I should've done this, I should've done that.
Original Witch Hunt (OG): Now that she had already received the ring from George, Shannon kept fidgeting in embarrassment. I should have done this, I should have done that.
PC Japanese (JP): 譲治に、もう指輪をもらった後の今になって、ああすれば良かったこうすれば良かったと、紗音はひとりもじもじと照れ隠しを続けているのだった。
Russian (RU): Теперь, когда она уже получила кольцо от Джорджа, Шаннон не могла найти себе места от смущения. Мне следовало поступить так, мне следовало поступить эдак.
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): Agora que ela já recebeu o anel de George, Shannon continua tímida e hesitante, tentando esconder sua vergonha, pensando se deveria ter feito aquilo ou não.
Chinese Traditional (CHT): 都已經收下了讓治戒指的紗音，獨自扭扭捏捏地，為了遮羞地想著，要是這麼做就好了，要是那麼做就好了。
Chinese Simplified (CN): 都已经收下了让治戒指的纱音，独自扭扭捏捏地，为了遮羞地想着，要是这么做就好了，要是那么做就好了。

Umineko Project (UP): As she did, she heard the sound of footsteps coming towards her, splashing through puddles.
Steam (ST): As she did, she heard the sound of footsteps splashing through puddles.
Original Witch Hunt (OG): As she did. she heard the sound of footsteps splashing through puddles.
PC Japanese (JP): そこへ、ばたばたと水溜りを踏み散らしながら駆けてくる足音を聞く。
Russian (RU): Предаваясь таким размышлениям, она услышала, как кто‐то шагает по лужам.
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): Foi então que ela ouviu o som de passo vindo em direção a ela, pisando em meio as poças de água.
Chinese Traditional (CHT): 此時，傳來了“啪嗒啪嗒”的，跑得水花四濺的腳步聲。
Chinese Simplified (CN): 此时，传来了“啪嗒啪嗒”的，跑得水花四溅的脚步声。

Umineko Project (UP): Shannon immediately chased away the emotions welling up inside her.
Steam (ST): Shannon immediately chased away the emotions welling up inside her.
Original Witch Hunt (OG): Shannon immediately chased away the emotions welling up inside her.
PC Japanese (JP): 紗音はすぐに浮かれた気持ちを追い出した。
Russian (RU): Шаннон тут же прогнала чувства, накапливающиеся в ней.
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): Shannon imediatamente descartou aquelas emoções que estavam brotando dentro dela.
Chinese Traditional (CHT): 紗音馬上趕跑了心中輕飄飄的情緒。
Chinese Simplified (CN): 纱音马上赶跑了心中轻飘飘的情绪。

Speaker: Shannon
Umineko Project (UP): "......Genji‐sama? Kanon‐kun too...! I, I'm sorry, for not coming back right away, umm..."
Steam (ST): "...Genji-sama? And Kanon-kun too...! I-I'm sorry, I have to go back soon, umm..."
Original Witch Hunt (OG): "......Genji-sama? Kanon-kun too...! I, I'm sorry, I have to go back soon, umm..."

Brazilian Portuguese (PT): "......Genji‐sama? O Kanon‐kun também...! E‐Eu peço desculpas por não ter voltado logo depois..."

Chinese Simplified (CN): 「……源次先生？连嘉音君也…！对、对不起，我没能马上回去，那个…，」

Umineko Project (UP): She grew stiff, thinking that she would surely be scolded for spending too much time in her secret lover's meeting with George.
Steam (ST): She grew stiff, thinking she'd surely be scolded for spending too much time in her secret lover's meeting with George.
Original Witch Hunt (OG): [=UP]
PC Japanese (JP): 譲治との逢瀬に時間を割きすぎたことを叱られるに違いないと、身を固くした。

Brazilian Portuguese (PT): Ela ficou rígida, pensando que seria duramente repreendida por ter passado muito tempo em seu encontro secreto amoroso com ele.
Chinese Traditional (CHT): 紗音以為自己一定會因與讓治的私會挪用了太多時間而挨罵，而顯得很拘謹。
Chinese Simplified (CN): 纱音以为自己一定会因与让治的私会挪用了太多时间而挨骂，而显得很拘谨。

Speaker: Ronoue Genji

Steam (ST): "Shannon, the Master told us to come to the study, saying it was urgent. Let us hurry."
Original Witch Hunt (OG): "Shannon. The Master told us to come to the study, saying it was urgent. Let us hurry."
PC Japanese (JP): 「紗音。お館様が至急、書斎へ来るようにとの仰せだ。急ぐぞ。」
PS3 Japanese - Censored (JPC): 「紗音。お館様が至急、書斎へ来るようにとの仰せだ。急ぐぞ」

Chinese Simplified (CN): 「纱音。老爷有令，火速去书房。快走。」

Umineko Project (UP): "......Huh? Y‐yes, certainly...! What in the world...?"
Steam (ST): "...Huh? Y-Yes, certainly...! What in the world...?"

Brazilian Portuguese (PT): "......Hã? S‐Sim, entendido...! O que está acontecendo...?"

Chinese Simplified (CN): 「……哎？是、是，遵命…！到底，是什么事呢…？」

Speaker: Kanon
Umineko Project (UP): "He said he had an ominous premonition. ......How selfish, when he was the one who chose to start this ritual."
Steam (ST): "He said he had a premonition of misfortune. ...How convenient for him, considering he's the one who started this ceremony."
Original Witch Hunt (OG): "He said he had a premonition of misfortune. ......It would be convenient if he could carry out the ceremony by himself."
PC Japanese (JP): 「不吉な予感がするってさ。……自分で儀式を起こしておいて、都合のいい話さ。」

Speaker: Ronoue Genji

Steam (ST): "We will enter from the back, so that Gohda doesn't notice us. Hide your footsteps."

PS3 Japanese - Censored (JPC): 「郷田に気取られぬよう、裏から入る。足音に気をつけろ」

Speaker: Kanon

Steam (ST): "Yes. ......Nee-san, take care. You're so noisy."

PS3 Japanese - Censored (JPC): 「はい。………姉さん、注意して。姉さんは賑やかだから」

Umineko Project (UP): Kanon was especially good at hiding his presence.
Steam (ST): Kanon was especially good at hiding his footsteps.
Original Witch Hunt (OG): Kanon was especially good at hiding his footsteps.
PC Japanese (JP): 嘉音は特に、気配を殺せるように出来ている。
Russian (RU): Канон был особенно хорош в сокрытии своих шагов.
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): Kanon era especialmente bom em esconder sua presença.
Chinese Traditional (CHT): 嘉音特別擅長悄無聲息地行動。
Chinese Simplified (CN): 嘉音特别擅长悄无声息地行动。

Umineko Project (UP): ...Like he was a cat. He was able to suddenly be there without anyone noticing, and leave in the same way.
Steam (ST): ...Just like a cat. He was able to suddenly be there without anyone noticing and leave in the same way.
Original Witch Hunt (OG): [=UP]
PC Japanese (JP): …例えるならば猫。誰にも気取られることなく、いつの間にかそこにいて、いつの間にか立ち去ることができる。
Russian (RU): ...Словно он был котом. Он мог внезапно и незаметно для всех объявиться и исчезнуть таким же образом.
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): ...Como se fosse um gato. Ele era capaz de aparecer de repente, sem que ninguém o notasse, e também se retirar da mesma forma.
Chinese Traditional (CHT): …打個比方，就像是只貓。能不讓任何人察覺到他的動靜，悄無聲息地出現，悄無聲息地離開。
Chinese Simplified (CN): …打个比方，就像是只猫。能不让任何人察觉到他的动静，悄无声息地出现，悄无声息地离开。

Umineko Project (UP): So, even if he were to step in a puddle, the sound he would make would be far smaller than that of the rain hitting the puddles...
Steam (ST): For example, even though he stepped in puddles, the sound he made was far smaller than that of the rain hitting them...
Original Witch Hunt (OG): For example, even though he stepped in the puddles, the sound he made was far smaller than that of the rain hitting the puddles...
PC Japanese (JP): だから例え、水溜りを踏むことになろうとも、その音は水溜りを叩く雨音よりも遥かに小さい…。
PS3 Japanese - Censored (JPC): だからたとえ、水溜りを踏むことになろうとも、その音は水溜りを叩く雨音よりも遥かに小さい…。
Russian (RU): К примеру, хоть он и шагал по лужам, но издаваемый им звук был ещё тише, чему звук капель, падающих в лужи...
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): Por isso, mesmo se ele pisasse em uma poça, o som que ele faria seria infinitamente menor do que o som das gotas de chuva caindo sobre a poça...
Chinese Traditional (CHT): 所以，即使是踏在水窪上，其所發出的聲音也遠比拍打水窪的雨聲要小得多…。
Chinese Simplified (CN): 所以，即使是踏在水洼上，其所发出的声音也远比拍打水洼的雨声要小得多…。

Umineko Project (UP): Genji also had that ability. ...Well, in the first place, that was how the servants were supposed to be, even going by the name of furniture.
Steam (ST): Genji also had abilities of that kind. ...Or rather, those servants called furniture were supposed to be like that.
Original Witch Hunt (OG): Genji also had that ability....Well, originally, those servants called furniture were supposed to be like that.
PC Japanese (JP): 源次もまた、そういう力を持ち合わせていた。…いや、本来、家具とまで呼ばれる使用人はそうあるべきなのだ。
Russian (RU): Генджи тоже так умел. ...Да и, в общем‐то, слугам, именуемым мебелью, полагалось так уметь.
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): Genji também possuía essa habilidade. ...Bem, em primeiro lugar, é assim que todos os serviçais deveriam ser, mesmo atendendo pelo nome de mobílias.
Chinese Traditional (CHT): 源次也具有這份能力。…不，歸根結底，被稱為家具的傭人就該是如此。
Chinese Simplified (CN): 源次也具有这份能力。…不，归根结底，被称为家具的佣人就该是如此。

Umineko Project (UP): Just like how desks and closets go unnoticed by members of the family, the servants also treated being able to show up unobtrusively when they needed to as their greatest virtue.
Steam (ST): Just like how desks and closets go unnoticed by members of the family, these servants also held it as a great virtue to just suddenly be there whenever they were needed.
Original Witch Hunt (OG): Just like how desks and closets went unnoticed by members of the family, the servants also treated being able to appear unconcernedly when they needed to as a great virtue.
PC Japanese (JP): 家人が机や戸棚に対して何の気配も感じないように、使用人もそうであり、彼らが必要とする時にさりげなく現れるのが最大の美徳なのだ。
Russian (RU): Точно так же как столы и шкафы оказывались незамеченными членами семьи, слуги также почитали способность невозмутимо появляться, когда в них нуждались, как добродетель.
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): Assim como mesas e armários deixam de ser notados pelos membros da família, os serviçais serem capazes de aparecer discretamente quando necessário é sua grande virtude.
Chinese Traditional (CHT): 就像家裡的人不會感覺桌子與櫥櫃有動靜一樣，傭人也該如此，在需要他們的時候十分自然地出現，乃是其最大的美德。
Chinese Simplified (CN): 就像家里的人不会感觉桌子与橱柜有动静一样，佣人也该如此，在需要他们的时候十分自然地出现，乃是其最大的美德。

Umineko Project (UP): In that sense, Shannon's footsteps still strongly asserted themselves.
Steam (ST): Compared to that, Shannon's footsteps still strongly asserted themselves.
Original Witch Hunt (OG): In that sense, Shannon's footsteps still strongly asserted themselves.
PC Japanese (JP): そこへ行くと、紗音の足音はまだ自己主張が強い。
Russian (RU): В таком смысле, шаги Шаннон здорово выдавали себя.
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): Neste sentido, os passos de Shannon eram fortemente assertivos.
Chinese Traditional (CHT): 在這一點上，紗音的腳步聲還存在著過強的自我主張。
Chinese Simplified (CN): 在这一点上，纱音的脚步声还存在着过强的自我主张。

Umineko Project (UP): ...She was also trying to hide her footsteps, but compared to Kanon and Genji, well, you could say she was a little more lively...
Steam (ST): ...She was also trying to hide her footsteps, but compared to Kanon and Genji...well, you could say she was a little more boisterous...
Original Witch Hunt (OG): [=UP]
PC Japanese (JP): …彼女なりに足音を潜めているつもりだが、嘉音たちのそれに比べれば、なるほど、賑やかとは言い得ていた…。
Russian (RU): ...Она старалась скрыть свои шаги, но в сравнении с Каноном и Генджи, ну, можно сказать, они были побойче...
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): ...Ela também estava tentando esconder seus passos, mas comparado com Kanon e Genji, bem, você poderia dizer que eles eram um pouco mais agitados...
Chinese Traditional (CHT): …雖然她也有在放輕腳步聲，但與嘉音他們相比，原來如此，倒是不得不說，動靜不小…。
Chinese Simplified (CN): …虽然她也有在放轻脚步声，但与嘉音他们相比，原来如此，倒是不得不说，动静不小…。

Umineko Project (UP): Eventually they reached the back door, and the three of them entered the mansion.
Steam (ST): Eventually, they reached the back door, and the three of them entered the mansion.
Original Witch Hunt (OG): Eventually they reached the back door, and the three of them entered the mansion.
PC Japanese (JP): やがて裏口に辿り着き、３人は屋敷の中に入った。
Russian (RU): В конце концов, они достигли чёрного входа в особняк и вошли в него.
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): Eventualmente eles chegaram à porta dos fundos, e os três então entraram na mansão.

Chinese Simplified (CN): 不久后，三人抵达后门，进了大屋。

Umineko Project (UP): Immediately, .........they thought they felt something.
Steam (ST): Immediately, ......they thought they felt something.
Original Witch Hunt (OG): Immediately, .........they thought they felt something.
PC Japanese (JP): すぐに、………何かを感じた気がした。
Russian (RU): И тут же... Они моментально что‐то ощутили.
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): Imediatamente, .........eles pensaram ter sentido algo.
Chinese Traditional (CHT): 馬上，………就覺得自己感覺到了什麼。
Chinese Simplified (CN): 马上，………就觉得自己感觉到了什么。

Umineko Project (UP): It wasn't quite a sense of smell, ...rather, they felt it from the depths of their noses, ......and this hard‐to‐describe sensation, which you might call a sixth sense, allowed them to perceive that something was different than usual.
Steam (ST): It was different from a sense of smell, ...and it seemed to hit the depths of their noses. ...This hard-to-describe sensation, which you might call a sixth sense, allowed them to perceive that something was different than usual.
Original Witch Hunt (OG): It was different from a sense of smell, ...it was as though they felt it from the depths of their noses, ......and this hard to describe sensation, which you might call a sixth sense, allowed them to perceive that something was different than usual.
PC Japanese (JP): 嗅覚とは違うけれど、…鼻の奥底で感じるような、……勘とでも言えばいいのか、形容し難い感覚が、いつもと違う何かを知覚した。
Russian (RU): Это отличалось от обоняния... Словно бы они ощутили это глубинами своих носов... И это трудно поддающееся описанию ощущение, которое можно было назвать шестым чувством, позволило им воспринять нечто отличающееся от обычного.
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): Não era exatamente um odor, ...embora eles tenha sentido profundamente com suas narinas, ......uma sensação difícil de se descrever, na qual você poderia chamar de sexto sentido, permitiu a eles perceber que havia algo diferente do usual.
Chinese Traditional (CHT): 雖與嗅覺不同，…但這像是從鼻子深處感到的，……該說是直覺才對麼，這難以形容的感覺，察覺到了與往常不同的什麼。
Chinese Simplified (CN): 虽与嗅觉不同，…但这像是从鼻子深处感到的，……该说是直觉才对么，这难以形容的感觉，察觉到了与往常不同的什么。

PC Japanese (JP): 強力な魔除けだ。金蔵の身を守る、最後の結界。{n}それが破られていた。
Russian (RU): Мощный отражатель магии. Последний барьер, защищавший самого Кинзо.{n}Он был разрушен.
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): Um poderoso repelente mágico. A barreira final que protegia Kinzo...{n}Havia sido quebrada.
Chinese Traditional (CHT): 這是強力的驅魔陣。是守護金藏之身的，最後的結界。{n}它被打破了。
Chinese Simplified (CN): 这是强力的驱魔阵。是守护金藏之身的，最后的结界。{n}它被打破了。

Umineko Project (UP): Of course, there was no change to the doorknob that the eye could see.{n}However, they who could understand things that people couldn't perceive, were able to recognize the dramatic change...
Steam (ST): Of course, there was no change to the doorknob that the eye could see. However, those who could understand things people couldn't perceive...were able to recognize that a dramatic change had occurred...
Original Witch Hunt (OG): Of course, there was no change to the doorknob that the eye could see. However, they who could understand things that people couldn't perceive, were able to recognize that there was a dramatic change...
PC Japanese (JP): もちろん、見た目にはそのドアノブに何の変化もない。しかし、人には知覚できぬものを理解できる彼らには、その劇的変化が理解できた…。
PS3 Japanese - Censored (JPC): もちろん、見た目にはそのドアノブに何の変化もない。{n}しかし、人には知覚できぬものを理解できる彼らには、その劇的変化が理解できた…。
Russian (RU): Разумеется, на ручке не наблюдалось изменений, доступных обычному глазу.{n}Но они, способные воспринимать вещи, недоступные восприятию обычных людей, смогли увидеть существенное изменение...
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): É claro, não havia nenhuma mudança visível na fechadura.{n}Entretanto, eles eram capazes de entender coisas que outras pessoas eram incapazes de perceber; eram capazes de reconhecer dramáticas mudanças...
Chinese Traditional (CHT): 當然，從外觀來看，這門把手沒有任何變化。{n}可是，能感知到人類無法感知的東西的他們，明白門把上有著劇烈的變化…。
Chinese Simplified (CN): 当然，从外观来看，这门把手没有任何变化。{n}可是，能感知到人类无法感知的东西的他们，明白门把上有着剧烈的变化…。

Speaker: Ronoue Genji
Umineko Project (UP): "......My lord. My lord...! It is Genji. Please open this door."
Steam (ST): "...Master. Master...! It is Genji. Please open the door."
Original Witch Hunt (OG): "......Master. Master...! It is Genji. Please open this door."
PC Japanese (JP): 「……お館様。お館様…！源次でございます。ここをお開け下さい。」
PS3 Japanese - Censored (JPC): 「……お館様。お館様…！　源次でございます。ここをお開け下さい」
Russian (RU): "......Господин. Господин!.. Это Генджи. Прошу вас, откройте дверь."
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): "......Mestre. Mestre...! É o Genji. Por favor, abra a porta."
Chinese Traditional (CHT): 「……老爺。老爺…！我是源次。請開門。」
Chinese Simplified (CN): 「……老爷。老爷…！我是源次。请开门。」

Umineko Project (UP): Genji called in this way after knocking several times, but there was no answer from the study.
Steam (ST): Genji called in this way after knocking several times, but there was no answer from the study.
Original Witch Hunt (OG): [=UP]
PC Japanese (JP): 源次が数度ノックしてそう声を掛けるが、書斎から返事はなかった。
Russian (RU): Несколько раз постучав в дверь, Генджи позвал Кинзо, но из кабинета не последовало ответа.
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): Genji o chamou após bater na porta diversas vezes, mas não havia nenhuma resposta vinda do estúdio.
Chinese Traditional (CHT): 源次如此喊著敲了幾下門，可書房中並無回應。
Chinese Simplified (CN): 源次如此喊着敲了几下门，可书房中并无回应。

Speaker: Ronoue Genji
Umineko Project (UP): "Shannon, protect our backs. Kanon, search inside the room."
Steam (ST): "Shannon, guard our backs. Kanon, search inside the room."
Original Witch Hunt (OG): [=UP]
PC Japanese (JP): 「紗音、背中を守れ。嘉音、室内を探れ。」
PS3 Japanese - Censored (JPC): 「紗音、背中を守れ。嘉音、室内を探れ」
Russian (RU): "Шаннон, прикрой нас со спины. Канон, прослушай комнату."
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): "Shannon, proteja nossa retaguarda. Kanon, procure dentro do quarto."

Chinese Simplified (CN): 「纱音，保护背后。嘉音，探听室内。」

Original Witch Hunt (OG): [=UP]
Russian (RU): ""Слушаюсь!..""
Chinese Simplified (CN): [=CHT]

Umineko Project (UP): Kanon put his ear against the door, searching for a presence inside the study.
Steam (ST): Kanon put his ear against the door, searching for a presence inside the study.
Original Witch Hunt (OG): [=UP]
PC Japanese (JP): 嘉音は扉に耳を当て、書斎の中の気配を探る。
Russian (RU): Канон приложил ухо к двери, пытаясь ощутить чьё‐нибудь присутствие внутри кабинета.
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): Kanon colocou seu ouvido contra a porta, buscando por qualquer presença dentro do estúdio.

Chinese Simplified (CN): 嘉音把耳朵贴到了门上，探听书房中的动静。

Umineko Project (UP): To protect the backs of the other two, who were watching the door, Shannon faced the other way, with her back to them, prepared for the unexpected.
Steam (ST): To protect the backs of the pair watching the door, Shannon faced the other way, ready for the unexpected.
Original Witch Hunt (OG): To protect the backs of the other two, who were watching the door, Shannon faced the other way, with her back to them, prepared for the unexpected.
PC Japanese (JP): 紗音は扉に注視する二人の背中を守るため、背を合わせるように逆を向き、不測の事態に備えた。
Russian (RU): Чтобы защитить спины пары, занятой дверью, Шаннон смотрела в другую сторону, спиной к ним, готовая к неожиданностям.
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): Para proteger as costas dos dois, que estavam olhando para a porta, Shannon se virou para o lado oposto, com as costas para eles, preparada para o inesperado.
Chinese Traditional (CHT): 紗音為了保護注視著門的他們兩人的背後，與他們背靠背，轉身面朝反方向，以防不測。
Chinese Simplified (CN): 纱音为了保护注视着门的他们两人的背后，与他们背靠背，转身面朝反方向，以防不测。

PS3 Japanese - Censored (JPC): 「…………お館様はいらっしゃられるはずです。…ですが、静か過ぎます」

Steam (ST): Genji pulled a gold key out of his pocket. It was the only key to the study that existed, other than the one Kinzo held.

PS3 Japanese - Censored (JPC): 源次は懐より、黄金の鍵を取り出す。{n}金蔵が持つ以外に、唯一存在する書斎の鍵だ。
Russian (RU): Генджи извлёк золотой ключ из своего кармана.{n}То был единственный ключ к кабинету помимо того, что держал при себе Кинзо.

Umineko Project (UP): He stuck it in the keyhole, and turned it heavily.{n}......At a glance, that would have indicated that it really was a strong lock.
Steam (ST): He stuck it in the key hole and turned it heavily. ...At first glance, that seemed to prove that it was a sturdy lock.
Original Witch Hunt (OG): He stuck it in the key hole, and turned it heavily.......At first glance, it looked like that meant that is really was a strong lock.
PC Japanese (JP): 鍵穴にそれを刺し、重い手応えで捻る。……一見、それは確かに厳重な施錠を示した。
PS3 Japanese - Censored (JPC): 鍵穴にそれを刺し、重い手応えで捻る。{n}……一見、それは確かに厳重な施錠を示した。

Brazilian Portuguese (PT): Ele a colocou na fechadura, virando‐a com certo esforço.{n}......De relance, aquilo indicaria que a tranca da porta era, de fato, forte.
Chinese Traditional (CHT): 插進鑰匙孔，轉動鑰匙時傳來了沉重的手感。{n}……乍一看，這代表著門確實鎖得很牢。
Chinese Simplified (CN): 插进钥匙孔，转动钥匙时传来了沉重的手感。{n}……乍一看，这代表着门确实锁得很牢。

Original Witch Hunt (OG): However, now that the barrier had been destroyed, this door was as good as open for anyone with magical power...
PC Japanese (JP): しかし、結界が破られているということは、魔力ある者にとって、この扉はすでに開きっぱなしと同じ意味だ…。
Russian (RU): Но с уничтожением и исчезновением барьера, данная дверь была фактически открыта нараспашку перед любым, наделенным магической силой...
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): Entretanto, o fato de que a barreira havia sido destruída...indicava que aquela porta havia sido aberta por alguém por meio de um poder mágico...

Original Witch Hunt (OG): The heavy sound meant that the door could be opened even by humans.

Chinese Simplified (CN): 随着重重的“噶嗒”一声，这扇门{i:对人类来说}，也已被打开。

Brazilian Portuguese (PT): Aquelas chamas se tornaram uma brilhante luz, com um deslumbrante brilho que iluminava os diversos utensílios mágicos que preenchiam o quarto, e fizeram suas distorcidas sombras dançaram pelas paredes.

Russian (RU): Какое‐то время похохотав и повыв в бушующем пламени, Кинзо рухнул на землю как марионетка, чьи ниточки обрезали.

Original Witch Hunt (OG): Those incredible blazing flames disappeared as though he had been completely burned up, and afterwards, all that was left was a festering and burnt corpse that would make you want to avert your eyes...

Brazilian Portuguese (PT): Aquelas incríveis e flamejantes chamas desapareceram como se já tivessem queimado tudo o que ali havia para queimar, e após, tudo o que restou era um corpo queimado e apodrecido que faria qualquer um desviar o olhar...
Chinese Traditional (CHT): 曾燃燒得那麼旺盛的火焰，猶如已將一切燒盡了般地消失無踪，之後就只剩下了，讓人不忍直視的，燒爛了的遺體…。

Chinese Traditional (CHT): 羅諾威啪地打了個響指，……如果源次是牽線木偶的話，那這就是能讓人錯以為線被剪斷了般的，…乾脆，卻又溫柔的癱倒。
Chinese Simplified (CN): 罗诺威啪地打了个响指，……如果源次是牵线木偶的话，那这就是能让人错以为线被剪断了般的，…干脆，却又温柔的瘫倒。

Umineko Project (UP): He fell, sprawled on the floor, into a sleep that witches couldn't call him back from...
Steam (ST): He crumpled, falling into a sleep that no witch could call him back from...
Original Witch Hunt (OG): He fell, sprawled on the floor, into a sleep that witches couldn't call him back from...
PC Japanese (JP): 彼は床に、崩れ落ちて、魔女たちには呼び戻せない眠りに落ちた…。
Russian (RU): Он упал, растянувшись на полу, уснув сном, который ведьме было не под силу отобрать...
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): Ele caiu, estabacado no piso, em um sono no qual bruxa nenhuma poderia trazê‐lo de volta...
Chinese Traditional (CHT): 他癱倒在地板上，落入了魔女們永遠喚不回來的沉眠…。
Chinese Simplified (CN): 他瘫倒在地板上，落入了魔女们永远唤不回来的沉眠…。

Umineko Project (UP): That was as filled with kindness as the sleep he had given Shannon and Kanon...
Steam (ST): It was as filled with kindness as the sleep he had given Shannon and Kanon...
Original Witch Hunt (OG): That was as filled with kindness as the sleep he had given Shannon and Kanon...
PC Japanese (JP): それは、彼が紗音たちに与えた眠りと同じくらいに、やさしさに溢れたものであった…。
Russian (RU): Также как и сон Шаннон с Каноном, его сон тоже был полон доброты...
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): Estava repleto de bondade, assim como o descanso dado a Shannon e Kanon...
Chinese Traditional (CHT): 這是與他給予紗音他們的沉眠一樣的，滿溢著溫情的沉眠…。
Chinese Simplified (CN): 这是与他给予纱音他们的沉眠一样的，满溢着温情的沉眠…。

Speaker: {f:5:Beatrice}
Umineko Project (UP): "......What was that, Ronove? ......What a boring anticlimax."
Steam (ST): "...What was that, Ronove? ...What a boring anticlimax."
Original Witch Hunt (OG): [=UP]
PC Japanese (JP): 「……何だよォ、ロノウェぇ。……拍子抜けでつまらぬぞ。」
PS3 Japanese - Censored (JPC): 「……何だよォ、ロノウェぇ。……拍子抜けでつまらぬぞ」
Russian (RU): "......Как же так, Ронове? ......Какой скучный спад напряжения."
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): "......O que foi isso, Ronove? ......Que anticlímax mais chato."
Chinese Traditional (CHT): 「……幹嘛啊，羅諾威。……敗興至極，沒意思。」
Chinese Simplified (CN): 「……干嘛啊，罗诺威。……败兴至极，没意思。」

Speaker: Ronove
Umineko Project (UP): "Are you not a powerful Great Witch, Milady? Something such as this is not enough to pay attention to. ......It is not like you to allow the blood to rush to your head because of provocation from someone like Shannon."
Steam (ST): "Are you not a mighty Great Witch, Milady? What happened here is hardly worthy of your concern. ...It isn't like you, to let the provocation of someone like Shannon get to you."
Original Witch Hunt (OG): "Are you not a powerful Great Witch, Milady? Something such as this is not enough to pay attention to. ......Having the blood rush to your head because of provocation from someone like Shannon, isn't like you."
PC Japanese (JP): 「お嬢様は偉大なる大魔女ではございませんか。この程度、気に留めるほどにもございませんよ。……紗音ごときの挑発で頭に血を上らせるなど、らしくもない。」
PS3 Japanese - Censored (JPC): 「お嬢様は偉大なる大魔女ではございませんか。この程度、気に留めるほどにもございませんよ。……紗音ごときの挑発で頭に血を上らせるなど、らしくもない」
Russian (RU): "Разве вы не могущественная ведьма, миледи? Нечто такое слишком мало, чтобы заслуживать внимания. ......Позволить крови ударить вам в голову из‐за провокации такого создания, как Шаннон, не похоже на вас."
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): "Você não é a poderosa Grande Bruxa, ojou‐sama? Algo como isto não é o suficiente para se dar atenção. ......Não é como se você permitisse que o sangue subisse a sua cabeça por causa de uma provocação de alguém como Shannon."
Chinese Traditional (CHT): 「小姐您可是偉大的大魔女啊。此等小事，根本無需介意。……只因區區紗音的挑釁就大腦充血，實在是不像您哦。」
Chinese Simplified (CN): 「小姐您可是伟大的大魔女啊。此等小事，根本无需介意。……只因区区纱音的挑衅就大脑充血，实在是不像您哦。」

PC Japanese (JP): ベアトリーチェは何が気に入らないのだろうか。…紗音の言葉の棘が、今もなお抜けないというのか。
PS3 Japanese - Censored (JPC): ベアトリーチェは何が気に入らないのだろうか。{n}…紗音の言葉の棘が、今もなお抜けないというのか。
Russian (RU): Было ли что‐то, что не понравилось {f:5:Беатриче}?{n}...Не могла ли она извлечь шип из слов Шаннон?

Umineko Project (UP): Ronove laughed lightly, as though lamenting the complexity of the human and the female heart, and ordered the Seven Sisters to go.
Steam (ST): Ronove laughed lightly, as though lamenting the complexity of humanity and a woman's heart, and ordered the Seven Sisters to go.
Original Witch Hunt (OG): Ronove laughed lightly, as though lamenting the complexity of humans and a woman's heart, and ordered the seven sisters to go.
PC Japanese (JP): ロノウェは、人間と女の心の複雑さを嘆くように薄く笑うと、七姉妹たちに行けと命じる。
Russian (RU): Ронове слегка рассмеялся, словно сокрушаясь о сложности людей и женского сердца, и приказал семи сёстрам уйти.
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): Ronove riu levemente, como se lamentasse a complexidade humana e o coração feminino, e ordenou as Sete Irmãs para que se retirassem.
Chinese Traditional (CHT): 像是在感嘆人類與女人心何等複雜似的，羅諾威輕輕一笑，命令七姐妹出發。
Chinese Simplified (CN): 像是在感叹人类与女人心何等复杂似的，罗诺威轻轻一笑，命令七姐妹出发。
